titles.title: All People That On Earth Do Dwell

authors.author: Ken Thomas Louis Bourgeois William Kethe

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: All people that on earth do dwell, newline Sing to the Lord with cheerful voice; newline Him serve with fear His praise forth tell, newline Come ye before Him and rejoice.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: The Lord, ye know, is God indeed, newline Without our aid He did us make; newline We are His flock, He doth us fee newline And for His sheep He doth us take.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: O, enter then His gates with praise, newline Approach with joy His courts unto; newline Praise laud and bless His name always, newline For it is seemly so to do.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: For why the Lord our God is good, newline His mercy is forever sure; newline His truth at all times firmly stood, newline And shall from age to age endure.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: Praise God from whom newline All blessings flow. newline Praise Him newline All creatures here below. newline Praise Him above newline Ye heav'nly host. newline Praise Father, Son, newline And Holy Ghost.
